page.title: 02HISTORICAL ELLAND
page.content: Elland is entered in the original Domesday book under Ealand (Anglo- Saxon'ea'water and'land'dwelling). R.Calder was shallow here and a plaque by the bridge tells of the murder of males of the Eland family in the Eland Feud.Above the river stands the Parish Church of St Mary the Virgin.The first church was built in 1180.Elland Bridge was the site of a ducking stool and a series of wooden bridges were built and rebuilt as early as 1199.The first stone bridge of 1579 had poor foundations and had to rebuilt in 1584 This in turn was swept away in 1615. It took 2 years to complete a new one. "Yorkshire mixtures" were begun in the church in Northgate. The first sweet making firm of J. Dobson & Sons situated there.Trays of sweets spilled by accident were liked by Thomas Dobson, hence their name.
